data.evacuation_notes: Windy Rock Fire Evacuation Map
data.reporter_only_notes:
Windy Rock and Devil Mountain are being ran together per the DNRC but are still getting individual size updates through NIFC. Only use the size that comes in the morning updates, disregard NIFC for now. - 8/29, EJ

8/31 - DNRC is inconsistent. They seem to be combining the acreage in the daily updates, but NOT the perimeters anymore. We have reactivated Devil Mountain and are posting the perimeters + acreage updates to each one individually. Keep an eye out for what looks to be a large increase in size in the daily, that's them combining sizes for Windy Rock+Devil Mountain, but not actually mentioning Devil Mountain in their text. -JW

-Still merging acreage for the fires as of 9/1am report. GH

-Appears perimeters have merged as of last night and we're a single fire now. GH 9/4

data.reporter_only_notes:
For clarity, Eagle County zone GYF-265 (smaller portion) has been "turned off" on the Eagle County Emergency Map and Genasys map so that the two zones are no longer overlapping. AJJ 08/24

There are duplicate zones named "GYF-265" which overlap and have conflicting statuses. The external status for the larger zone is incorrect. We've labeled them smaller/larger portion in custom evac notes to differentiate the two. Ensure that you toggle the correct zone to the correct status. Double-check the Watch Duty map with the linked official map. ~LW 8/24

data.reporter_only_notes:
The fire burned very aggressively today toward the east into the wilderness. Jaimee and I discussed adding Fremont County but decided it's still a little far from the county line for that. I suggest using the Shoshone NF boundary as a trigger point to the E and Seven Lakes ATV trail to the N for adding Fremont county. Lots of wilderness out there, lots of room to run.

NIFC has 10,000 right now, not using since we have a perimeter at 13,000 8/26 -EJ

data.reporter_only_notes:
8/31 - Stevens County is combining the evacuation zone info for Blackhawk Mountain and Crown Creek together as of today. Recommend double checking the source info closely as both may need updates. -JW

9/6 - "Tomorrow the Crown Creek Fire will reflect the combined acreage with the Blackhawk Mountain Fire." FYI from the IMT daily update. When this happens, please remove the acreage from Blackhawk Mtn meta and update on Crown Creek only. -JW

9/10 - It's fine to push the perimeter as silent, then update the total acreage off the IMT updates. Instead of us having to calculate Blackhawk Mtn + Crown Creeks joint acreage using two separate perimeters. - MS

data.evacuation_warnings: Curry County: Rogue River Ranch, Tucker Flat Campground and Marial Note: this zone is not visible on the Watch duty map and can be viewed via Raptor.
data.evacuation_notes: RAPTOR evacuation map Road Closure: Grave Creek to Marial Backcountry Byway near the Rogue River Ranch for firefighter and public safety. The public is strongly encouraged to avoid the entire Byway to facilitate safe firefighter access on the steep, narrow, windy road. Members of the public may not enter closed areas, and all uses—including hiking, hunting and dispersed camping—are prohibited. The closure order encompasses BLM Road 32-9-14.2 along the Grave Creek to Marial Backcountry Byway.
data.reporter_only_notes: With the amount of activity in this area try and keep normal reports to a minimum unless providing important/pertinent or evacuation related information - CE
